workstreams.name: Compatibility
workstreams.scope: CSS properties and DOM APIs that web browsers need to support for compatibility with the de facto web.

standards.name: Compatibility
standards.description: The Compatibility Standard describes a collection of non-standard (and often vendor-prefixed) CSS properties and DOM APIs that web browsers need to support for compatibility with the de facto web.

standards.name: Console
standards.description: The Console Standard defines APIs for console debugging facilities.

workstreams.name: DOM
workstreams.scope: The web's model for events, aborting activities, and node trees.

standards.name: DOM
standards.description: The DOM Standard defines the core infrastructure used to define the web.

workstreams.name: Encoding
workstreams.scope: Character encodings on the web, and their JavaScript API.

standards.name: Encoding
standards.description: The Encoding Standard defines how character encodings work on the web.

workstreams.name: Fetch
workstreams.scope: The networking model for resource retrieval on the web.

standards.name: Fetch
standards.description: The Fetch Standard defines the networking model for resource retrieval on the web.

workstreams.name: Fullscreen API
workstreams.scope: An API for web pages to take over a user's entire screen.

standards.name: Fullscreen API
standards.description: The Fullscreen API Standard defines how web pages can take over a user's entire screen (at the user's request), e.g., for gaming or to watch a video.

workstreams.name: HTML
workstreams.scope: A kitchen sink full of technologies for the web, including the core markup language for the web, HTML, as well as numerous APIs like Web Sockets, Web Workers, `localStorage`, etc.

standards.name: HTML
standards.description: The HTML Standard is a kitchen sink full of technologies for the web. It includes the core markup language for the web, HTML, as well as numerous APIs like Web Sockets, Web Workers, `localStorage`, etc.

workstreams.name: Infra
workstreams.scope: The fundamental concepts upon which standards are built.

standards.name: Infra
standards.description: The Infra Standard aims to define the fundamental concepts upon which standards are built.

workstreams.name: MIME Sniffing
workstreams.scope: Algorithms used to determine the type of resources.

standards.name: MIME Sniffing
standards.description: The MIME Sniffing Standard defines algorithms used to determine the type of resources.

workstreams.name: Notifications API
workstreams.scope: An API to display notifications to alert users outside the context of a web page.

standards.name: Notifications API
standards.description: The Notifications API Standard provides an API to display notifications to alert users outside the context of a web page.

workstreams.name: Quirks Mode
workstreams.scope: Quirks in CSS and Selectors that are necessary to support for web browsers for compatibility with the web.

standards.name: Quirks Mode
standards.description: The Quirks Mode Standard describes behaviours in CSS and Selectors that are not yet defined in the relevant specifications but that are nonetheless widely implemented.

workstreams.name: Storage
workstreams.scope: APIs for persistent storage and quota estimates, as well as the web platform storage architecture.

standards.name: Storage
standards.description: The Storage Standard defines an API for persistent storage and quota estimates, as well as the platform storage architecture.

workstreams.name: Streams
workstreams.scope: Web APIs for creating, composing, and consuming streams of data that map efficiently to low-level I/O primitives.

standards.name: Streams
standards.description: The Streams Standard provides APIs for creating, composing, and consuming streams of data that map efficiently to low-level I/O primitives.

workstreams.name: URL
workstreams.scope: URLs, their infrastructure, and their API.

standards.name: URL
standards.description: The URL Standard defines the infrastructure around URLs on the web.

workstreams.name: XMLHttpRequest
workstreams.scope: A client-side networking API for transferring data between a web page and a server.

standards.name: XMLHttpRequest
standards.description: The XMLHttpRequest Standard defines the networking API exposed to scripts on the web.

ideas.name: CSS Books
ideas.description: CSS Books defines CSS features for book publishing and high-quality printing of web pages.

ideas.name: CSS Figures
ideas.description: CSS Figures defines CSS features for floating elements around pages and columns.
